intro: Senecio lorentziella, commonly known as the Lorentzella groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in gardens as an ornamental plant.
